snippet: The commander in the Lord’s Resistance Army, a rebel group in central Africa, was charged in The Hague with 70 war crimes and crimes against humanity....
abstract: Dominic Ongwen, senior commander of Ugandan rebel group Lord's Resistance Army, goes on trial in The Hague, charged with crimes that include spearheading massacres and kidnapping thousands of children for sexual slavery and conscription as soldiers; Ongwen, who has been subject of international warrant for 11 years, denies charges.
lead_paragraph: The commander in the Lord’s Resistance Army, a rebel group in central Africa, was charged in The Hague with 70 war crimes and crimes against humanity.

headline.main: Dominic Ongwen, Ugandan Rebel Leader, Denies Charges at I.C.C. Trial
headline.print_headline: Ugandan Rebel Leader Denies Charges at I.C.C. Trial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
